meanings.definition: Relating to or resembling a dome.
meanings.sent1: The domical roof of the building added a unique touch to its design.
meanings.sent2: The church had a beautiful domical structure that stood out in the city skyline.
meanings.sent3: The children found a large, domical rock in the park and pretended it was a magical castle.
meanings.sent4: The sun set behind the domical hills, casting a warm glow over the landscape.
meanings.sent5: The astronaut marveled at the domical shape of the planet from space, like a giant marble suspended in the universe.

meanings.definition: Having the shape of a dome.
meanings.sent1: The domical glass ceiling of the conservatory allowed sunlight to filter through beautifully.
meanings.sent2: The igloo was a perfect example of a small, domical shelter built from ice blocks.
meanings.sent3: The chef created a delicious domical cake that looked like a miniature version of a grand cathedral.
meanings.sent4: The hot air balloon rose gracefully into the sky, its domical silhouette against the clouds.
meanings.sent5: The snow globe contained a tiny, domical world with a miniature village and swirling snowflakes.
